intro: Marlierea cannifolia, commonly known as the cannifoliate marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that resemble those of the cannabis plant, giving it its common name. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Marlierea cannifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
